title: Representation of a solid medium.
description:
Contains relevant property values of a solid medium.
Schema on github: https://github.com/Engineer2B/PowerCalculator-Schemas

Name.description: A unique identifier of the solid medium.

Longitudinal.description:
[m/s] The speed of sound of a wave that oscillates in the traveling direction.
See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speed_of_sound.

Transversal.description:
[m/s] The speed of sound of a wave that oscillates in the direction that is transverse to the traveling direction.
See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speed_of_sound.

Longitudinal.description:
[Np/m] The acoustic attenuation of a wave that oscillates in the longitudinal direction.
Can also be an equation string with parameter 'T' for temperature in [K].
See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attenuation and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neper.

Transversal.description:
[Np/m] The acoustic attenuation of a wave that oscillates in the transversal direction.
Can also be an equation string with parameter 'T' for temperature in [K].
See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attenuation and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neper.

Density.description:
[kg/(m^3)] The amount of mass per volume.
Can also be an equation string with parameter 'T' for temperature in [K].
See also: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Density.

Heat absorption fraction.description: [-] The fraction of the heat that contributes to a temperature increase.

Isobaric mass heat capacity.description:
in [(m^2)/(K s^2)] or, more familiar, [J/(kg K)].
The ratio of the heat added to (or removed from) an object to the resulting temperature change per unit mass at constant pressure.

Thermal conductivity.description:
in [(kg m)/(s^3 K)] or, more familiar, [(W m)/K].
The property of a material to conduct heat evaluated in terms of Fourier's Law for heat conduction.

Atmospheric pressure melting point.description: [K] The temperature at 1 atm at which the medium changes to the fluid phase.
